title: New Advanced Labeling across cameras mode='match' Issue

labels.name: howtousedlc
labels.description: issue regarding the use of DeepLabCut

body:
**Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version**
OS: Windows 10 Professional 1803
DeepLabCut: 2.1.10.4
Anaconda Env used: 2020.11 Version

**Describe the problem**

Hello,
I am currently working on a 3DLC Project and I am trying to use the New Advanced Labeling Across Cameras functions, however I am having some trouble. 

I created a 3D Project and calibrated my 2 cameras, although once I check the undistortion, I get black images in return in the undistortion file. Please find attached the checkerboard_3d, original_image and undistorted_points. 
1) Original_Image: https://www.dropbox.com/s/jy3848dutqewnh0/Original_Image.png?dl=0
2) Undistorted_points: https://www.dropbox.com/s/csq9bpancd2yr90/undistorted_points.png?dl=0
3) Checkerboard_3d: https://www.dropbox.com/s/zq9vw8wx6v79uve/checkerboard_3d.png?dl=0

I would like to inform you that my setup is orthogonal, and based on the issue #1128, this may be the reason why I am getting black pictures in result. I still have not tried the triangulation part to see if it works, though. Instead, I wanted to try the new Advanced Labeling Across Cameras functions. 

I succeeded in extracting the frames from the videos of camera-7, however once I try the function dlc.extract_frames(config_path_camera-8, mode='match', config3d=config_path3d, extracted_cam=0), I do not get any of the matched frames in return. 
I checked the config file paths many times but I can not detected any issue there. Also, the camera names are correct in the config files. 

Here are 2 screenshots of the code in the terminal : 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82345816/116695549-102b7d80-a9c1-11eb-954b-aac989d0f601.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82345816/116695608-23d6e400-a9c1-11eb-88d5-b7d40b060987.png)

Please let me know if you would like extra documentation and thank you in advance! 

Best, 
Eviana
